Welcome to PiCloud’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class server.ClientSocket(host, port)[source]¶

This is a wrapper subclass of the socket.socket class. Used primarily for simplicity.

class server.ServerSocket(port)[source]¶

This is a wrapper subclass of the socket.socket class. Creates a socket with a few predefined variables.

activate()[source]¶

This activates the main server event loop for accepting incoming connections.

server.evaluate(sock)[source]¶

This function takes a socket produced by the accept() method of the main server. It then receives the incoming data and evaluates it based on its features.

server.pre_proc(filename, is_server=0)[source]¶

The pre_proc function opens a file name with the name filename (directory and file extension included!), and then encodes the data into byte string, while encoding key info into the communication protocol. If the filename does not exist on the local drive, and the function is being used as a client (is_server = 0), it will return an encoded request for that file. If the file cannot be found, and the function is being used as a server, a FileError is returned.

server.send_file(sock, b_data)[source]¶

This function structures a single file (in byte string) into the form: [length of byte string + byte string]. Then it sends the structured data to the connected socket. The b_data variable must be in byte string. The sock variable is a socket object which sends the data.

Introduction¶

PiCloud is a server/client software suite being developed for use in file/folder sync across multiple devices.
